page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY OF MELKSHAM
page.content: St.Michael's Church in the middle of town is about 800 years old. The oldest gravestone is 230 years old. The first vicar of the church was a man called Romoldus, who was vicar in the 11th century. In the church there are many old bibles, the oldest being about 100 years old. In the graveyard there are some graves with a fence around them, belonging to wealthy people. Altogether there are thousands of graves, but we do not know exactly. At the front of the church there is a yew tree, which has been there for 500 years. In 1840 the tower was moved to the east end of the church. The average number of people in church on a Sunday is 140. Mr.Fisher, the present vicar, likes being a vicar because he likes working within other people.
